author: Albert Einstein
quote: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated.

author: Steve Jobs
quote: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work.

author: C.S. Lewis
quote: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

author: Walt Disney
quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.

author: Oprah Winfrey
quote: You become what you believe.

author: Thomas Edison
quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.

author: Confucius
quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

author: J.K. Rowling
quote: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.

author: Nelson Mandela
quote: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
quote: The time is always right to do what is right.

author: Aristotle
quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: This above all: to thine own self be true.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
quote: Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.

author: Helen Keller
quote: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched, they must be felt with the heart.

author: John F. Kennedy
quote: Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.

author: Dalai Lama
quote: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.

author: Henry Ford
quote: Whether you think you can, or you think you can't – you're right.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.

author: Anne Frank
quote: No one has ever become poor by giving.

author: Bruce Lee
quote: Absorb what is useful, discard what is not, add what is uniquely your own.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you'll be criticized anyway.

author: Winston S. Churchill
quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.

author: Coco Chanel
quote: Success is most often achieved by those who don’t know that failure is inevitable.

author: Frank Sinatra
quote: The best revenge is massive success.

author: Babe Ruth
quote: Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.

author: Muhammad Ali
quote: Don't count the days, make the days count.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
quote: Even the smallest person can change the course of the future.

author: Ayn Rand
quote: The question isn’t who is going to let me; it’s who is going to stop me.

author: Malcolm X
quote: If you have no critics, you'll likely have no success.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.

author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
quote: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.

author: George Eliot
quote: It's never too late to be what you might have been.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. It's about creating yourself.

author: Pablo Picasso
quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once we grow up.

author: Charles Darwin
quote: It is not the strongest of the species that survive, nor the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change.

author: Rumi
quote: The wound is the place where the light enters you.

author: John Wooden
quote: Success is never final, failure is never fatal. It's courage that counts.

author: Dr. Seuss
quote: Why fit in when you were born to stand out?

author: Jimi Hendrix
quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.

author: Mae West
quote: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

author: Winston S. Churchill
quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Once you stop learning, you start dying.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: You can’t use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.

author: Steve Jobs
quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.

quote: Once you stop learning, you start dying.

author: Maya Angelou

author: Steve Jobs
quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.

author: Ernest Hemingway
quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.

author: Heraclitus
quote: Change is the only constant in life.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: Doubt grows with knowledge.

author: Epicurus
quote: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.

author: Mark Twain
quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.

author: Socrates
quote: An unexamined life is not worth living.

author: Voltaire
quote: Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers.

author: Plato
quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.

author: John Lennon
quote: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: Do one thing every day that scares you.

author: Bruce Lee
quote: The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.

author: Aesop
quote: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.

author: George Bernard Shaw
quote: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.

author: John C. Maxwell
quote: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.

author: Aristotle
quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.

author: Napoleon Hill
quote: Whatever the mind can conceive and believe, it can achieve.

author: Mae Jemison
quote: Never limit yourself because of others' limited imagination; never limit others because of your own limited imagination.

author: Helen Keller
quote: The best way to predict the future is to create it.

author: George Washington Carver
quote: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.

author: Elbert Hubbard
quote: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.

author: Jim Rohn
quote: Either you run the day, or the day runs you.

author: William James
quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down.

author: Epictetus
quote: We cannot choose our external circumstances, but we can always choose how we respond to them.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
quote: Not all those who wander are lost.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
quote: Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.

author: Confucius
quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.

author: Coco Chanel
quote: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited, whereas imagination embraces the entire world, stimulating progress, giving birth to evolution.

quote: I would rather die of passion than of boredom.
